revised_title: Development and Properties of a Reproducible Neutron Standard
tldr: The authors propose radium beryllium fluoride (RaBeF4) as a new, reproducible neutron standard. They prepare and calibrate three sources, finding that the neutron yield is proportional to the radium content within 1%. The authors discuss the techniques used in the preparation and standardization of these sources and the possible errors in calibration. This new standard simplifies nuclear physical experiments by providing a more reliable and reproducible neutron source.
